S. Korean police threaten to issue warrants for arrest of leading members of KCTU
articles.content:
S. Korean police threaten to issue warrants for arrest of leading members of KCTU 
    Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Seoul district police office threatened to issue warrants for the arrest of leading members of the South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions including its chairman Tan Pyong Ho and severely punish them, according to Seoul-based Radio No. 1.
 It revealed its intention to arrest the chairman of the KCTU, recalling that a notice had already been sent to him several times to come to the police on charges of over 20 cases of violation of the "law on assembly and demonstration."    
 It also intends to issue warrants of arrest or summons to 6 persons including the chief for the organization of disputes of the KCTU, branding the workers' demonstration as a "violent one."
